channel.title: Interesting OpEd from Ars Technica on PGP
channel.description:
http://arstechnica.com/security/2016/12/op-ed-im-giving-up-on-pgp/
His main premise is that the web of trust model fundamentally breaks several important things, such as encouraging long-lived keys. I'm a fan of GPG for encryption, but I've always found it unwieldily for communication. Thoughts?

item.title: Interesting OpEd from Ars Technica on PGP
item.dc:creator: fraq
item.description:
Ars Technica

Op-ed: I’m throwing in the towel on PGP, and I work in security

“If you need to securely contact me... DM me asking for my Signal number.”

His main premise is that the web of trust model fundamentally breaks several important things, such as encouraging long-lived keys. I’m a fan of GPG for encryption, but I’ve always found it unwieldily for communication. Thoughts?
